Class PersonMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • PersonMethods

  • public class PersonMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    This class groups all methods used to create and modify Person objects.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nadia Botha

    • Constructor Detail

      • PersonMethods

        public PersonMethods()

    • Method Detail

      • createNewArchitect

        public static Person createNewArchitect()
        This method lets the user create a new project architect.

        This method requests the user to fill in the fields (name, number, email address and physical address) to define the architect Person object. This input is used to create and return the Person object.

        Returns:
        returns the Person object with all relevant fields, name, telephone number, email address and physical address
        See Also:
        #Person(String, String, String, String, String)

      • createNewContractor

        public static Person createNewContractor()
        This method lets the user create a new project contractor.

        This method requests the user to fill in the fields (name, number, email address and physical address) to define the contractor Person object. This input is used to create and return the Person object.

        Returns:
        returns the Person object with all relevant fields, name, telephone number, email address and physical address
        See Also:
        #Person(String, String, String, String, String)

      • createNewCustomer

        public static Person createNewCustomer()
        This method lets the user create a new project customer.

        This method requests the user to fill in the fields (name, number, email address and physical address) to define the customer Person object. This input is used to create and return the Person object.

        Returns:
        returns the Person object with all relevant fields, name, telephone number, email address and physical address
        See Also:
        #Person(String, String, String, String, String)

      • addNewPersonToArray

        private static java.util.ArrayList<Person> addNewPersonToArray(java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetails,
                                                               Person newPerson)
        This method adds a newly created Person object(architect, contractor and customer) to the existing Persons.

        The newly created Person object is added to the existing Person ArrayList by means of the add method. The person is added in the first empty array index.

        Parameters:
        allPersonsDetails - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        newPerson - new Person object that was created, which has not yet been added to the Person ArrayList.
        Returns:
        returns the updated ArrayList which also includes the newly created Person object.

      • personIndexInPersonArray

        public static int personIndexInPersonArray(java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetails,
                                           java.lang.String personName)
        This method looks for a specific Person by means of the person name.

        This method loops through the Person ArrayList and looks for a specific Person object based on the personName field. The method then returns the index of this Person object within the Person ArrayList.

        Parameters:
        allPersonsDetails - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        personName - Person object name and surname string which forms the personName field.
        Returns:
        returns the index integer of a specific Person object within the Person ArrayList.
        See Also:
        #getPersonName()

      • addPersonToArrayAndWriteToFile

        public static void addPersonToArrayAndWriteToFile(java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetails,
                                                  Person projectPerson)
        Method adds a newly created Person object to the exiting persons and updates the text file accordingly where all the persons are saved.

        Calls the addNewPersonToArray method, to add the Person object to the Person ArrayList. Then converts the Person ArrayList to a String array by calling the convertPersonArrayToString method. After that the string method is written to the person text file by calling the writeUpdatedInfoToPersonTextFile, which permanently saves the Person object to the database.

        Parameters:
        allPersonsDetails - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        projectPerson - new Person object that was created, which has not yet been added to the Person ArrayList or written to person.txt.
        See Also:
        #addNewPersonToArray(ArrayList, Person), #convertPersonArrayToString(ArrayList), #writeUpdatedInfoToPersonTextFile(String[]), ../person.txt

      • editProjectCustomerContactDetails

        public static int editProjectCustomerContactDetails(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                                    java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList,
                                                    Project[] allProjectsDetailsArray,
                                                    int indexToEdit)
        This method enables the user to edit an existing customer's contact details for a specific project.

        The method displays which details can be edited, request the user to select and option and then executes the option by calling the relevant method. If the user desires to update the customer number, editProjectCustomerNumber is called. If the user selects the customer email address, the editProjectCustomerEmailAddress is called. If the user selects the customer physical address, the editProjectCustomerPhysicalAddress method is called. The code to update the person.txt and project.txt files are located within editProjectCustomerPhysicalAddress, editProjectCustomerNumber and editProjectCustomerEmailAddress. After editing the contact details, the user is requested to enter an option for the main menu by calling runMainMenu method.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Integer entered by the user which determines if it is the customer number, email address or physical address that should be updated.
        allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        allProjectsDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        indexToEdit - Array index integer of the project to be edited within the Projects Array.
        Returns:
        returns the integer for the next option chosen by the user on the main menu.
        See Also:
        #personIndexInPersonArray(ArrayList, String), #runMainMenu(), #editProjectCustomerNumber(Scanner, ArrayList, Project[], int, int), #editProjectCustomerEmailAddress(Scanner, ArrayList, Project[], int, int), #editProjectCustomerPhysicalAddress(Scanner, ArrayList, Project[], int, int)

      • editProjectCustomerPhysicalAddress

        private static void editProjectCustomerPhysicalAddress(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                                       java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList,
                                                       Project[] allProjectsDetailsArray,
                                                       int indexToEdit,
                                                       int personIndexToEdit)
        This method enables the user to edit an existing customer's physical address for a specific project.

        The method looks for the specific project within the existing Project array and obtains the index. The project details for this index is then obtained, of which the customer Person object is one. The customer Person object is then accessed to get the existing physical address which is displayed. A new value is requested from the user, and the customer Person object physicalAddress field is set equal to this new value. The person.txt and projects.txt is updated accordingly.

        Parameters:
        userInput - String input from the user to define the new physical address.
        allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        allProjectsDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        indexToEdit - Array index integer of the project to be edited within the Projects Array.
        personIndexToEdit - Index integer of the person to be edited within the Person ArrayList.
        See Also:
        #getProjectCustomer(), #getPhysicalAddress(), #setPersonPhysicalAddress(String), #convertProjectArrayToStringArray(Project[]), #writeUpdatedInfoToProjectTextFile(String[]), #convertPersonArrayToString(ArrayList), #writeUpdatedInfoToProjectTextFile(String[][])

      • editProjectCustomerEmailAddress

        private static void editProjectCustomerEmailAddress(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                                    java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList,
                                                    Project[] allProjectsDetailsArray,
                                                    int indexToEdit,
                                                    int personIndexToEdit)
        This method enables the user to edit an existing customer's email address for a specific project.

        The method looks for the specific project within the existing Project array and obtains the index. The project details for this index is then obtained, of which the customer Person object is one. The customer Person object is then accessed to get the existing email address which is displayed. A new value is requested from the user, and the customer Person object physicalAddress field is set equal to this new value. The person.txt and projects.txt is updated accordingly.

        Parameters:
        userInput - String input from the user to define the new email address.
        allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        allProjectsDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        indexToEdit - Array index integer of the project to be edited within the Projects Array.
        personIndexToEdit - Index integer of the person to be edited within the Person ArrayList.
        See Also:

      • editProjectCustomerNumber

        private static void editProjectCustomerNumber(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                              java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList,
                                              Project[] allProjectsDetailsArray,
                                              int indexToEdit,
                                              int personIndexToEdit)
        This method enables the user to edit an existing customer's telephone number for a specific project.

        The method looks for the specific project within the existing Project array and obtains the index. The project details for this index is then obtained, of which the customer Person object is one. The customer Person object is then accessed to get the existing telephone number which is displayed. A new value is requested from the user, and the customer Person object telephoneNumber field is set equal to this new value. The person.txt and projects.txt is updated accordingly.

        Parameters:
        userInput - String input from the user to define the new telephone number.
        allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        allProjectsDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        indexToEdit - Array index integer of the project to be edited within the Projects Array.
        personIndexToEdit - Index integer of the person to be edited within the Person ArrayList.

      • editProjectContractorContactDetails

        public static int editProjectContractorContactDetails(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                                      java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList,
                                                      Project[] allProjectsDetailsArray,
                                                      int indexToEdit)
        This method enables the user to edit an existing contractor's contact details.

        The method displays which details can be edited, request the user to select and option and then executes the option by calling the relevant method. If the user desires to update the customer number, editProjectContractorNumber is called. If the user selects the customer email address, the editProjectContractorEmailAddress is called. If the user selects the customer physical address, the editProjectContractorPhysicalAddress method is called. The code to update the person.txt and project.txt files are located within editProjectContractorPhysicalAddress, editProjectContractorNumber and editProjectContractorEmailAddress. After editing the contact details, the user is requested to enter an option for the main menu by calling runMainMenu method.

        Parameters:
        userInput - Integer entered by the user which determines if it is the contractor number, email address or physical address that should be updated.
        allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        allProjectsDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        indexToEdit - Array index integer of the project to be edited within the Projects Array.
        Returns:
        returns the integer for the next option chosen by the user on the main menu.
        See Also:
        #personIndexInPersonArray(ArrayList, String), #runMainMenu(), #editProjectContractorNumber(Scanner, ArrayList, Project[], int, int), #editProjectContractorEmailAddress(Scanner, ArrayList, Project[], int, int), #editProjectContractorEmailAddress(Scanner, ArrayList, Project[], int, int)

      • editProjectArchitectContactDetails

        public static int editProjectArchitectContactDetails(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                                     java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetailsPersonArrayList,
                                                     Project[] allProjectsDetailsArray,

        The method displays which details can be edited, request the user to select and option and then executes the option by calling the relevant method.
